item.title: Russia, Ukraine and US set to hold security talks in Abu Dhabi
item.description: Russia said it will hold security talks with the US and Ukraine in Abu Dhabi on Friday, but warned after a late-night meeting between President Vladimir Putin and three US envoys that a durable peace would not be possible unless territorial issues were resolved. Kremlin aide Yuri Ushakov told repo

item.title: Dinajpur to have city corporation if Jamaat wins: Shafiqur
item.description: Jamaat-e-Islami chief Shafiqur Rahman has given assurances that Dinajpur will be converted into a city corporation if his party gets the opportunity to form a government. He said, “For a larger district, city corporations have become district headquarters in many places. Do you have a city c

item.title: Joint forces arrest 278 across Bangladesh in weeklong drive: ISPR
item.description: -Members of the joint forces, led by the Bangladesh Army, arrested 278 suspected criminals in a nationwide drive between Jan 16 and Jan 22, said the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) on Friday. The operations were conducted in different parts of the country, including the capital, by units un

item.title: Heathrow's new scanners end dreaded rummage for liquids and laptops
item.description: Passengers will no longer be forced to dig around in their hand luggage to extract shampoos, water bottles and laptops when travelling through security at Heathrow, Europe's busiest airport, thanks to new specialist scanners. Heathrow said on Friday that all security lanes across its four terminal

item.title: AL ban strips Feb 12 vote of democratic legitimacy, Hasina
item.description: Sheikh Hasina has launched a stinging political broadside against the interim government, accusing Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus of replacing constitutional rule with what she calls “authoritarianism dressed up as transition” by sidelining her party Awami League ahead of the Feb 12 gener

item.title: Bangladesh, Costa Rica eye stronger ties
item.description: Costa Rica has expressed its support for Bangladesh’s upcoming candidacy as a non-permanent member of the UN Security Council, as the two countries seek to strengthen relations across all potential areas. item.title: Jamaat chief sets three conditions for 'collaborative’ governance
item.description: Jamaat-e-Islami chief Shafiqur Rahman has promised to build the nation inclusively if his party is given the chance to form the government, while laying out three conditions for governance. He addressed a large election rally of the 10-party alliance at Thakurgaon Government Boys’ High Schoo

item.title: CA for building democratic social system with spirit of 1969 Mass Uprising
item.description: Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus today urged all to come forward towards building a truly democratic social system, imbued with the values of the 1969 mass uprising. "Let us all dedicate ourselves to building a truly democratic social system respecting the values of the 1969 mass uprising,"

item.title: BNP to solve salt industry problems, if voted to power: Salahuddin
item.description: BNP Standing Committee member Salahuddin Ahmed on Friday assured salt workers of resolving existing problems in the country’s salt industry once BNP is voted to power through the upcoming general elections. He made the assurance during his surprise visit to a salt field located in Magnama La

item.title: ‘Child not beaten that way’: teacher in court
item.description: A teacher at Dhaka’s Sharmin Academy has appeared in court after being arrested over allegations of child abuse, with police seeking five days to question him. Pabitra Kumar was arrested in Mirpur early on Friday and presented before a Dhaka Metropolitan Magistrate over accusations of abusin

item.title: Farooki highlights Bangladesh cricket team's security concerns in India
item.description: Cultural Affairs Adviser Mostofa Sarwar Farooki has raised concerns over the security of the national cricket team ahead of upcoming matches in India, citing recent attacks on people suspected to be Bangladeshis and political remarks warning against hosting Bangladesh in certain cities. item.title: LafargeHolcim Bangladesh gets Top Employer certification for 2026
item.description: LafargeHolcim Bangladesh Plc (LHB) has been certified as a Top Employer for 2026, the company said in a press release.
